article.title: Measurement of the running of the fine structure constant below 1 GeV with the KLOE detector

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red line in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The square of the modulus of the running α(s) as measured by KLOE.
The theoretical prediction for α(s) with α(s) = α(0).
The theoretical prediction for α(s) with only virtual lepton pairs contributing to Δα(s).
The full QED prediction with both lepton and quark pairs contributing to Δα(s).

multiple_choice_question.text: What is being compared in the left panel of Figure 2?
choices: The real part of Δα extracted from KLOE data to theoretical predictions.
The imaginary part of Δα extracted from KLOE data to theoretical predictions.
The KLOE measurement of the running of α(s) with and without hadronic contributions.
The relative contributions of lepton and quark pairs to the running of α(s).

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the blue solid line in the right panel of Figure 2 represent?
choices: The theoretical prediction for Re Δα with only lepton contributions.
The theoretical prediction for Re Δα with both lepton and hadron contributions.
The KLOE measurement of Re Δα with statistical errors.
The contribution of the ρ resonance to Re Δα.
The Breit-Wigner parametrization for the ρ resonance contribution to Re Δα.
The contribution of the ω and φ resonances to Re Δα.
The total hadronic contribution to Re Δα.
The relationship between the running of α(s) and the total cross-section for electron-positron annihilation.
